SGCCRfC Wiki

GNSS Processing

GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite Systems) processing enables precise positioning, crustal deformation monitoring, atmospheric studies, and geodetic research.

ğŸ“¡ GNSS Constellations

  • GPS (USA)
  • GLONASS (Russia)
  • Galileo (Europe)
  • BeiDou (China)
  • QZSS (Japan)
  • IRNSS/NavIC (India)

ğŸ›°ï¸ Types of GNSS Processing

1. Static Processing

High accuracy for geodesy & crustal deformation.

2. Kinematic Processing

Positioning for navigation, UAVs, surveying.

3. PPP â€” Precise Point Positioning

Uses precise clocks & orbits for global accuracy.

4. RTK â€” Real-Time Kinematic

Centimeter accuracy using baseâ€“rover architecture.

5. GNSS Interferometry

Tropospheric delay estimation & atmospheric sensing.

ğŸ”§ Open-Source GNSS Tools

RTKLIB

Standard for open-source RTK/PPP processing.
ğŸ”— https://github.com/tomojitakasu/RTKLIB

GPSTk

Toolkit for GNSS processing & simulation.
ğŸ”— https://github.com/SGL-UT/GPSTk

GAMIT/GLOBK (free academic license)

Network adjustment & GNSS geodesy.
ğŸ”— https://geoweb.mit.edu/gg/

TEQC (archived)

RINEX editing, quality checking.
ğŸ”— https://www.unavco.org/software/data-processing/teqc/teqc.html

PyGNSS

Python utilities for GNSS analysis.
ğŸ”— https://github.com/iondynamics/pygnss
